name: opencode-background
description: Background process management plugin offering robust process tracking and lifecycle management with tagging and filtering capabilities.

installation.summary: Install via npm and add to OpenCode configuration for background process management.
installation.markdown:
## Installation

### Via npm
```bash
npm install @zenobius/opencode-background
```

Add to `~/.config/opencode/config.json`:
```json
{
  "plugins": ["@zenobius/opencode-background"]
}
```

### Local Development
```bash
git clone https://github.com/zenobi-us/opencode-background.git ~/.opencode-background
cd ~/.opencode-background && bun install && bun run build
```

Then use:
```json
{
  "plugins": ["~/.opencode-background"]
}
```

usage.markdown:
## Usage

### Creating Background Processes
```bash
⚙ createBackgroundProcess
  command=/tmp/long-process.sh
  name="Long Running Process"
  tags=["long-process", "processing"]
  global=false
```

### Process Types
- **Session-Specific** (default): Auto-terminated when session ends
- **Global**: Persist across sessions until explicitly stopped

### Listing and Filtering
```bash
⚙ listBackgroundProcesses
  sessionId=current_session_id

⚙ listBackgroundProcesses
  tags=["processing"]
```

### Process Termination
```bash
⚙ killProcesses
  processId=specific-process-id

⚙ killProcesses
  tags=["critical"]
```

### Features
- **Real-time output tracking** (last 100 lines)
- **Process tagging** for categorization
- **Advanced filtering** by session, status, or tags
- **Automatic cleanup** on session/application close
- **Process states**: pending, running, completed, failed, cancelled
- **Detailed metadata**: start/completion times, error tracking
